text: I know five people, all good writers, who put-together would have as many original ideas as the columnists on the NYT op-ed page, often a lot more provocative, interesting, stimulating of more ideas. The people at the NYT are risk-averse, usually expressing ideas that there's already a consensus for. In other words, there isn't much new on the op-ed page. I always try to figure out how we can put our heads together and make a product that people will listen to, because the insiders in journalism almost never venture outside their circle. And like it or not they have huge power in forming our futures, for better or worse, and imho mostly worse.
